decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates (The works to reduce the height of the panels/supports) shall be completed within three months of the date of this consent.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Site location plan and drawings 'Proposed Elevation 01 Rev 1A, Proposed Elevation 02 Rev 2A & Proposed Elevation detail 03 Rev 3A'

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Informative (enforcement)- The applicant's attention is drawn to the requirements of Condition 1, that the works hereby approved to reduce the height of the relevant panels be completed within three months of the date of this consent. Failure to accord with this condition may lead to enforcement action due to potential risk to users of the highway and for aesthetic reasons.

Condition : 5 - Informative (hardstanding)  - This consent relates solely to the matters applied for and does not confer or imply to confer consent for the existing hardstanding, which, in order to be permitted development, must be finished in a permeable material and or have a drainage system that allows for the disposal of water through the ground within the curtilage of the application site. In the event those works do not accord with permitted development rights, planning permission would be required.

Condition : 6 - INFORMATIVE
 In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The applicant/agent was provided with pre-application advice.
   iii) The application was approved within the agreed time frame.
description: THE ERECTION OF BOUNDARY FENCING TO THE FRONT OF THE HOUSE.
